w:r.w:t: This document contains the instructions for preparing a paper submitted to COLING-

or accepted for publication in its proceedings. The document itself conforms to its own specifications, and is therefore an example of what your manuscript should look like. These instructions should be used for both papers submitted for review and for final versions of accepted papers. Authors are asked to conform to all the directions reported in this document.

Centre the title, author's name(s) and affiliation(s) across
Do not use footnotes for affiliations. Do not include the

Do not include the authors’ names or affiliations in the version submitted for review.
at the top of the first page, in

titles should be typed on two lines
without a blank line intervening. Approximately, put the title at 2.5

author's names(s), and the affiliation on the following line. Do not
use only initials for given names (middle initials are allowed). Do
). Do not format title and section headings in all
author's complete address, and if possible, an electronic mail
address. Start the body of the first page 7.5 cm from the top of the
The title, author names and addresses should be completely identical
to those entered to the electronical paper submission website in order
to maintain the consistency of author information among all
publications of the conference. If they are different, the publication
co-chairs may resolve the difference without consulting with you; so it
is in your own interest to double-check that the information is
: Type the abstract between addresses and main body.
The width of the abstract text should be
smaller than main body by about 0.6 cm on each side.
font above the body of the abstract. The abstract should be a concise
summary of the general thesis and conclusions of the paper. It should
be no longer than 200 words. The abstract text should be in 1
Begin typing the main body of the text immediately after
the abstract, observing the single-column format as shown in the present document. Do not include page numbers.
hen starting a new paragraph. Use 11
footnote on the first page of the final, camera-ready paper.
: Type and label section and subsection headings in the
style shown on the present document. Use numbered sections (Arabic
numerals) in order to facilitate cross references. Number subsections
with the section number and the subsection number separated by a dot,
in Arabic numerals. Do not number subsubsections.
: Citations within the text appear in parentheses
or, if the author's name appears in the text
to the year in cases of ambiguity. Treat double authors as

. Also refrain from using full citations

If you are using the provided
As reviewing will be double-blind, the submitted version of the papers
should not include the authors' names and affiliations. Furthermore,
self-references that reveal the author's identity, e.g.,
should be avoided. Instead, use citations such as
any of the following when submitting your paper for review:
acknowledgements, project names, grant numbers, and names or URLs of
resources or tools that have only been made publicly available in
the last 3 weeks or are about to be made
and would compromise the anonymity of the submission
conform to these requirements may be rejected without review.
These details can, however, be included in the camera-ready, final paper.
